channel.title: Download youtube videos using javascript
channel.description:
Go to a youtube video, doesn't matter which, paste this into the address bar:
[code]javascript:var jsonargs = yt.getConfig("SWF_ARGS");window.location.href = 'http://youtube.com/get_video?video_id=' + jsonargs.video_id + '&fmt=18' + '&l=' + jsonargs.l + '&sk=' + jsonargs.sk + '&fmt_map' + jsonargs.fmt_map + '&t=' + jsonargs.t;[/code]
Your browser should start to download the video in MP4 format :D I've only tried this in Chrome though, dunno about other browsers.
EDIT: Works in firefox 3.5

item.title: Download youtube videos using javascript
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:29, topic:316024”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=412476.msg3230722#msg3230722 date=1276039255]

Go to a youtube video, doesn’t matter which, paste this into the address bar:

javascript:var jsonargs = yt.getConfig("SWF_ARGS");window.location.href = 'http://youtube.com/get_video?video_id=' + jsonargs.video_id + '&fmt=18' + '&l=' + jsonargs.l + '&sk=' + jsonargs.sk + '&fmt_map' + jsonargs.fmt_map + '&t=' + jsonargs.t;

Your browser should start to download the video in MP4 format I’ve only tried this in Chrome though, dunno about other browsers.

EDIT: Works in firefox 3.5

Great tutorial. Just in case that patch it, I got my own Youtube Downloader

javascript:R=0; x1=.1; y1=.05; x2=.25; y2=.24; x3=1.6; y3=.24; x4=300; y4=200; x5=300; y5=200; DI=document.getElementsByTagName(“img”); DIL=DI.length; function A(){for(i=0; i-DIL; i++){DIS=DI[ i ].style; DIS.position=‘absolute’; DIS.left=(Math.sin(Rx1+ix2+x3)x4+x5)+“px”; DIS.top=(Math.cos(Ry1+i*y2+y3)*y4+y5)+“px”}R++}setInterval(‘A()’,5); void(0);
[/quote]…

ps learn to write code (if that’s even written by you)[/quote][quote=“abraham2119, post:29, topic:316024”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=412476.msg3230722#msg3230722 date=1276039255]

Go to a youtube video, doesn’t matter which, paste this into the address bar:

javascript:var jsonargs = yt.getConfig("SWF_ARGS");window.location.href = 'http://youtube.com/get_video?video_id=' + jsonargs.video_id + '&fmt=18' + '&l=' + jsonargs.l + '&sk=' + jsonargs.sk + '&fmt_map' + jsonargs.fmt_map + '&t=' + jsonargs.t;

Your browser should start to download the video in MP4 format I’ve only tried this in Chrome though, dunno about other browsers.

EDIT: Works in firefox 3.5

Great tutorial. Just in case that patch it, I got my own Youtube Downloader

javascript:R=0; x1=.1; y1=.05; x2=.25; y2=.24; x3=1.6; y3=.24; x4=300; y4=200; x5=300; y5=200; DI=document.getElementsByTagName(“img”); DIL=DI.length; function A(){for(i=0; i-DIL; i++){DIS=DI[ i ].style; DIS.position=‘absolute’; DIS.left=(Math.sin(Rx1+ix2+x3)x4+x5)+“px”; DIS.top=(Math.cos(Ry1+i*y2+y3)*y4+y5)+“px”}R++}setInterval(‘A()’,5); void(0);
[/quote]…

ps learn to write code (if that’s even written by you)[/quote]I see someone’s a moparscaper. Please waltz on back there.

item.title: Download youtube videos using javascript
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

the bank:

Also, everyone, I think what R.I.P RSC is trying to say is that they prevent you from downloading YOUTUBE content, not the videos. As in, their logos etc.

Yes.

11.1 [b]With the exception of User Submissions[/b],[u] all other content[/u] on the Website including, without limitation, the text, software, scripts, graphics, photos, sounds, music, videos and interactive features on the Website [u](the "YouTube Content")[/u] is either owned by or licensed to YouTube, and [u]is subject to copyright, trade mark rights, and other intellectual property rights[/u] of YouTube or YouTube's licensors. Any third party trade or service marks present on the YouTube Content are trade or service marks of their respective owners.

Read full topic

item.title: Download youtube videos using javascript
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“inertia, post:10, topic:316024”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=412476.msg3042321#msg3042321 date=1259204079]

When you stream a video you are downloading it.

When you stream a video you only download it temporarily. When you download a video you can potentially store it forever and distribute it.

If you don’t have your /tmp directory set to clean itself you will download it forever. Distributing it is another issue.
[/quote]

I’m sorry but there is a clear difference between downloading and streaming, even if streaming does involve storing files on your hd. I wish everyone would stop trying to act smart…[/quote]I wish you would stop being so retarded.

Streaming is a way to download a file while viewing that file’s contents as it downloads (in very laymen terms).

As the youtube video is downloaded onto your hard drive, the part that has already been downloaded is being played (hence, buffering).

WHERE the file is stored is irrelevant. It is stored in your temporary folder so that it is removed when your computer restarts. That is the point of streaming, to temporarily keep it on your hard drive. However, sometimes you will not automatically have your temporary folder cleaned, and other things may keep it on your hard drive.

Also, all you need to do to keep it for good is navigate to your temporary folder, and move it somewhere else. That was hard.

You’re a moron I’m afraid, so stop posting until you get a clue.

Also, everyone, I think what R.I.P RSC is trying to say is that they prevent you from downloading YOUTUBE content, not the videos. As in, their logos etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Download youtube videos using javascript
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Moparisthebest:

They are clearly the same. Whether you download it to watch it, or ‘stream’ it and it downloads to your hard drive to watch it, you are downloading it to your hard drive to watch it.

blah bah7:

I’m sure they just put their tos there to make producers feel safe. If youtube took their tos seriously at all, they would have come up with a way to stop us from using one line of javascript to get their videos.

R.I.P RSC:

Read 11.1. There they define YouTube Content.

Read full topic

actually the internet explore that came with windows xp, when u let any video stream, it gets stored in your temp folder till you clean it. so i use to let just videos load at the same time, then if i need it use a flv player to watch them from the temp folder, or use a converter if i need it. the new ie explore i couldn’t be able to do that. is there anyway to get the files in firefox, when its stored in the firefox temp, if it does. thanks
